title.narrative: WHO Independent Review of China Health Reform

description.narrative: In April 2009 China’s State Council released its Decision Paper of China Health Reform and Development, marking the start of a major reform of China’s health sector. In March 2011 the State Council’s Health Reform Leadership Group chaired jointly by the National Development and Reform Committee (NDRC) and Ministry of Health (MOH) – asked WHO to facilitate an international and independent review of the Reform. The review’s goal is to assess progress and develop recommendations for the Chinese Government on how best to take forward the reform process. The review report is expected to be delivered to Chinese authorities in September 2011. Both the Chinese authorities and the WHO are committed to ensuring the review is beyond reproach, in both ensuring its membership is comprised of internationally-respected health experts and in being a truly independent review. China and WHO decided to seek funding from a third party, and to that end, AusAID has been formally contacted by China’s Minis
